Quick search

Enter search terms or a module, class or function name.

download moduleÂ¶

Download PDB files from the RCSB website.

While you can use this module directly, it is intended to be used by the higher-level modules (e.g. the project module which downloads PDB files of a given project, to keep the local working directory up-to-date).

download.CHUNK_LEN_PER_PROCESS = 20Â¶

This number impact the frequency of progress updates. It is the number of PDB files to download before a progress update is printed if a single process is used. This is scaled automatically to the number of processes used to keep the progress updates constant.

download.alphafold_id_to_file(pdb_id: str) → str[source]Â¶

Convert an AlphaFold ID to the corresponding PDB file name.

NB: there are gigantic protein like https://www.rcsb.org/uniprot/Q8WZ42

>>> alphafold_id_to_file("AF_AFP08437F1")
'AF-P08437-F1-model_v4.pdb'
>>> alphafold_id_to_file("AF_AFP01308F2")
'AF-P01308-F2-model_v4.pdb'
>>> alphafold_id_to_file("AF_AFQ8WZ42F166")
'AF-Q8WZ42-F166-model_v4.pdb'
download.download(pdb_ids: List[str], directory: str, compressed: bool = True, n_jobs=1) → None[source]Â¶

Download PDB files from the RCSB website in parallel, reporting the progress.

(actually, this is a wrapper around parallel_download)

Since we want to periodically notify the user about the progress and the ETA, this function just calls the parallel_download function several times with different chunks of PDB IDs, and when each chunk is finished, it prints the progress and the ETA. Since each chunk is downloaded in parallel, to have a constant rate of progress updates, we need to make sure that the number of chunks is a multiple of the number of processes, so that each process gets the same number of PDB IDs to download.

Parameters:

  • pdb_ids â€“ list of PDB IDs.

  • directory â€“ directory to store the downloaded files.

  • compressed â€“ whether to download compressed files.

  • n_jobs â€“ number of processes to use (default: 2).

download.download_pdb(pdb_id: str, directory: str, compressed: bool = True) → str[source]Â¶

Download a PDB file from the RCSB website.

Parameters:

  • pdb_id â€“ PDB ID.

  • directory â€“ directory to store the downloaded file.

  • compressed â€“ whether to download compressed files.

Returns:

path to the downloaded file.

download.filename_to_pdb_id(filename: str) → str[source]Â¶

Convert a PDB file name to the corresponding PDB ID.

>>> filename_to_pdb_id("1abc.pdb")
'1abc'
>>> filename_to_pdb_id("1abc.pdb.gz")
'1abc'
>>> filename_to_pdb_id("AF-P01308-F1-model_v4.pdb")
'AF_AFP01308F1'
>>> filename_to_pdb_id("AF-Q8WZ42-F166-model_v4.pdb")
'AF_AFQ8WZ42F166'
download.get_download_url(pdb_id: str) → str[source]Â¶

Based on the PDB ID, return the right URL to download the PDB file.

download.is_alphafold_id(pdb_id: str) → bool[source]Â¶

Check whether the PDB ID is an AlphaFold ID.

download.parallel_download(pdb_ids: List[str], directory: str, compressed: bool = True, n_jobs: int = 1) → List[str][source]Â¶

Download PDB files from the RCSB website in parallel.

Parameters:

  • pdb_ids â€“ list of PDB IDs.

  • directory â€“ directory to store the downloaded files.

  • compressed â€“ whether to download compressed files.

  • n_jobs â€“ number of processes to use (default: 1).

download.pdb_id_to_filename(pdb_id: str) → str[source]Â¶

Convert a PDB ID to the corresponding PDB file name.

>>> pdb_id_to_filename("1abc")
'1abc.pdb'
>>> pdb_id_to_filename("1abc")
'1abc.pdb'
>>> pdb_id_to_filename("AF_AFP01308F1")
'AF-P01308-F1-model_v4.pdb'
>>> pdb_id_to_filename("AF_AFQ8WZ42F166")
'AF-Q8WZ42-F166-model_v4.pdb'
